result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa E Gutierrez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor AMENDED FROM Bail jumping felony, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Melissa E Gutierrez in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  Plea to ct. 2  as amended to CM BJ  DRI remaining charges.  Defense req: Community service.  Defendant is participating in drug court in Milwaukee and is in Phase.  Defendant participating in 2 self help meetings per week as she is able.  Defendant pleas NC and is found G by the court.    

BTC:  w/h  1 yr probation:  follow through and complete treatment program in Milwaukee.  Once you graduate you must attend 2 self help groups per week.  Must give signed proof of attendace to the agent.  Pay cost of supervision and court costs.   Supervision to be transferred to Milwaukee.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Reading waived.
Pre-trial conference at 02-12-2016 08:15 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 12-9-2015:  ZCI testing eliminated as a condition of bond.**
NG plea entered.
